question.body: Which of the following diseases would include an example of hypotonia?

multiple_choice.choice: Floppy infant syndrome- which includes an infant becoming abnormally limp when lying prone
Parkinsonism- which includes rigidity of the muscles (involuntary stiffening).
Cerebral palsy- which includes uncontrolled muscle spasms.
None of these diseases would include an example of hypotonia.

response.feedback: Correct. Floppy infant syndrome has flaccid muscles which is an example of hypotonia.
Incorrect. Rigidity is a symptom of hypertonia
Incorrect. Spasticity is a symptom of hypertonia
Incorrect. Floppy infant syndrome has flaccid muscles which is an example of hypotonia.
